author: Caesar
eng: after setting fire to all the villages and buildings
ned: na alle gehuchten en hoeven in brand gestoken te hebben

author: Caesar
eng: they filled the swamp with earth
ned: ze dempten het moeras met aarde

author: Caesar
eng: they heard that the Haedui were approaching the territory of the Bellovaci
ned: zij hadden vernomen dat de Haedui het gebied van de Bellovaci naderden

author: Caesar
eng: he assigned horses to the gladiators
ned: hij wees de gladiatoren paarden toe

author: Caesar
lat: mollīs ac minimē resistēns ad calamitātēs ferendās mēns Gallōrum est
eng: the mind of the Gauls is soft and not resistant to suffering losses
ned: the Gauls are not mentally hard and not at all resistant to taking losses

author: Caesar
lat: collem propter magnitūdinem circuitūs opere circumplectī nōn poterant
eng: they could not enclose the hill with siege works because of its large size
ned: zij konden de heuvel vanwege de enorme omvang niet met belegeringswerken insluiten

author: Caesar
eng: they surrounded the man and killed him
ned: zij omsingelen de man en doden hem

author: Caesar
lat: petunt ā Vercingetorige, ut ratiōnēs bellī gerendī commūnicet
eng: they ask Vercingetorix to discuss strategy with them together
ned: zij vragen Vercingetorix gezamenlijk de strategie te bespreken

author: Caesar
eng: he had acquired great authority for himself
ned: hij had zich groot gezag verworven

author: Caesar
eng: he spotted Caesar's cavalry from afar
ned: hij zag de ruiterij van Caesar van verre

author: Caesar
eng: some of them took refuge in the nearby marshes
ned: een deel nam de wijk naar de aangrenzende moerassen

author: Caesar
eng: the work is uninterrupted throughout the day and night
ned: werk dat ononderbroken dag in dag uit voortduurt

author: Caesar
eng: all disputes are settled through discussion
ned: door gesprekken worden alle geschillen bijgelegd
